intro: Mundulea, commonly known as the white karkar, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Mundulea species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
